location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.325 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to events on the Batinah Coast, and the lack of response that Kemball has had from the Imam of Muscat Syed Soweynee [Thuwaini bin Said]. Kemball encloses a translation of a letter he has received from the Native Agent at Sharjah, Hajee Yacoob [Hajji Yaqoob], dated 13 September 1853, which describes the movements of troops in the region, and the contents of letters exchanged by those tribal leaders ranged against Muscat.
